question_details.title: Will Fivethirtyeight update its polling tracker again before April 1, 2025?
question_details.description: Twitter/X Nathaniel Rakich: [Incredibly sad to report that ABC News is indeed eliminating 538.](https://x.com/baseballot/status/1897326289658491357)
question_details.resolution_criteria: This question resolves as **Yes** if Fivethirtyeight's [Latest Polls page](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/) has been updated with a timestamp after the launch of this question and before April 1, 2025. If this is not the case for any reason, including the resolution page being pulled from the internet, this question resolves as **No**.

news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**Mexican Government Explains Voting Process for 2025 Judicial Power Elections**
The Mexican government has explained how citizens will vote in the 2025 Judicial Power elections, which will take place on June 1. According to Rosa Icela Rodríguez, Secretary of Governance, there will be up to 84,202 polling stations across the country. The voting process will involve six ballots of different colors, each with its own content. The ballots will include the election of federal judges, as well as local judges in 19 federal entities. Rodríguez explained that citizens will have to choose candidates for each ballot, with specific requirements for each one. For example, the purple ballot will require the election of five women and four men for the Supreme Court of Justice of the Nation (SCJN), while the blue ballot will require the election of one woman and one man for the Magistratures of the Superior Chamber of the Electoral Tribunal of the Judicial Power of the Federation. The government expects over 100,000 citizens to vote in these elections. As Rodríguez said, 'It is essential to take into account that in the white boxes, you must indicate the number of candidates you want to choose, and in each one, put the number of the candidate you want to choose.' 
Original language: es
Publish date: March 19, 2025 08:01 PM
Source:[SDPnoticias.com](https://www.sdpnoticias.com/mexico/elecciones-poder-judicial-2025-gobierno-de-mexico-explica-como-votar-en-cada-una-de-las-boletas)

**Trump Tariff Tracker -- March 19**
President Trump has announced plans to implement reciprocal tariffs and tariffs on automobiles on April 2. He stated, 'they charge us, and we charge them. Then, in addition to that, on autos, on steel, on aluminum, we're going to have some additional [tariffs].' A list of implemented, pending, or proposed tariffs since January 20, 2025, has been compiled to track the developing landscape of U.S. tariffs. The list will be updated weekly as new tariffs are implemented and new targets for tariffs are identified.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 19, 2025 03:04 PM
Source:[JD Supra](https://www.jdsupra.com/legalnews/trump-tariff-tracker-march-19-9363524/)

**Genshin Impact Version 5.5 arrives next week, adding a new five star character obsessed with food**
Genshin Impact Version 5.5, 'Day of the Flame's Return', is set to launch next week on March 26. The update introduces two new playable characters: Varesa, a 5-star Electro Catalyst user with a unique design and a laid-back personality, and Iansan, a 4-star Electro Polearm user and fitness instructor with workout-themed attacks. The update also expands the open-world, allowing players to venture into the area surrounding the Great Volcano of Tollan, where they will encounter a new tribe, the Collective of Plenty, and a new Saurian, the Tatankasaurus. Additionally, a new event, the 'Tournament of Glory in Bloom', will be available, featuring the new NPC character Ifa, and new optimizations, including a boss tracker and a revamped Artifact levelling experience.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 19, 2025 02:43 PM
Source:[TechRadar](https://www.techradar.com/gaming/genshin-impact-version-5-5-arrives-next-week-adding-a-new-five-star-character-obsessed-with-food)

**Latvia's Election Commission Announces Changes for Upcoming Municipal Elections**
The head of the Central Election Commission (CEC) of Latvia, Kristine Saulite, announced that voters can expect changes in the upcoming municipal elections, including new ballots and mobile voting stations. According to Saulite, the new ballots will feature two fields - red and green - for voters to mark their preferences. 'The old system of ballots caused confusion among voters, as it was not always clear. The new ballots are much easier for citizens. Information on how to fill out the ballots will be available at polling stations,' Saulite explained. The new ballots are set to be used in the next year's elections and in the 2029 European Parliament elections. Additionally, mobile voting stations will be introduced, which will be temporarily set up in crowded areas chosen by local authorities. 'Information about mobile polling stations must be provided 30 days before the elections, so that the CEC can inform the public,' Saulite noted. Another innovation will be 'split' polling stations, which can operate at different addresses at different times. Municipal elections in Latvia are scheduled to take place in early June, with candidate lists to be submitted by April 8.
Original language: ru
Publish date: March 19, 2025 01:16 PM
Source:[Sputnik Латвия](https://lv.sputniknews.ru/20250319/glava-tsik-izbirateley-zhdut-izmeneniya--29941444.html)

**Mauritian Municipal Elections 2025: Five Days to Register for Supplementary Electoral Register**
Citizens in five Mauritian cities have five days to register for the supplementary electoral register, which will be in effect from April 4, 2025. According to Irfan Abdool Raman, the electoral commissioner, the Representation of the People Act has been amended and approved by the President of the Republic. The commissioner added that the regulation for counting votes on the day of the election will be implemented soon. Two categories of voters are concerned: those whose names are not on the current electoral register and those who will be 18 years old or younger by April 4, 2025. They must bring their birth certificate or ID card and proof of address. It is recommended that voters check if their name is already on the current electoral register before registration. The five cities of Mauritius are concerned, with 19 registration centers opening in the following times: Thursday, Friday, and Monday from 4pm to 6pm, and Saturday and Sunday from 9am to 4pm. To be eligible to run in the municipal elections, a candidate must be a resident of the same city. The five cities have 120 municipal councilors.
Original language: fr
Publish date: March 19, 2025 12:34 PM
Source:[Le Defi Media Group](https://defimedia.info/elections-municipales-2025-cinq-jours-pour-sinscrire-sur-le-registre-electoral-supplementaire)

**China to Implement Tracking Code for Pharmaceutical Sales Starting July 2025**
Starting from July 2025, pharmaceutical sales in China will require scanning the product's tracking code to proceed with medical insurance settlements. According to a joint notice from the National Healthcare Security Administration and other four departments, all medical institutions will be required to collect and upload the tracking codes of all pharmaceuticals to the national unified medical insurance information platform and the pharmaceutical tracking system by January 1, 2026. The notice emphasizes the importance of accurate collection and verification of tracking codes, and the display of tracking code information on customer receipts at retail pharmacies. The notice also aims to promote the application of tracking codes in medical insurance directories, commercial insurance directories, provincial medical procurement platforms, and centralized bulk procurement. The National Healthcare Security Administration will establish a tracking information collection and query function on the national unified medical insurance information platform and provide public services to allow insured individuals to query tracking codes and protect their health rights.
Original language: zh
Publish date: March 19, 2025 12:00 AM
Source:[人民网](http://health.people.com.cn/n1/2025/0319/c14739-40442374.html)

**ZHIYUN Set to Unveil Latest Innovations at NAB 2025**
ZHIYUN will be showcasing its latest innovations at NAB 2025 in Las Vegas, including new lighting solutions and gimbals. The company will unveil two new products: a compact, bright RGB COB light and a high brightness panel light. ZHIYUN will also demonstrate its range of popular Molus, Fiveray, and Cinepeer lights, as well as its Crane, Weebill, and Smooth series gimbals. The company's products are designed to empower creativity and provide professional-level features with consumer-level ease-of-use. ZHIYUN's SMOOTH 5S AI smartphone stabilizer gimbals feature powerful AI tracking technology, making professional-level video quick and easy to shoot. The company will be at Booth N2875 in the North Hall at the Las Vegas Convention Center from April 6 to April 9, 2025. 'We believe in 'MAKE IT REAL': a commitment to arduous research and development to create breakthroughs in technological and industrial innovations,' said ZHIYUN. 'Our standout products and features deliver everyday convenience, better experiences, and unlock new opportunities to make the imagination a reality.'
Original language: en
Publish date: March 18, 2025 07:13 PM
Source:[openPR.com - Open Public Relations Free of Charge](https://www.openpr.com/news/3922476/zhiyun-set-to-unveil-latest-innovations-at-nab-2025)

**Who Can Vote in the 2025 Polish Presidential Elections?**
The presidential elections in Poland will take place on Sunday, May 18, 2025. In the previous presidential elections in 2020, the turnout was 64.51% in the first round and 68.18% in the second round. Polish citizens who have turned 18 and have not been deprived of this right by a court judgment are entitled to vote. However, individuals who have been incapacitated or deprived of public rights cannot participate in the elections. Additionally, those who turn 18 after the election date will have to wait for the next opportunity to cast their vote. Voters can cast their ballots in designated polling stations, but those who are outside their place of residence on election day have convenient options. They can obtain a certificate of the right to vote, which allows them to vote in any location in the country or abroad, or they can register to vote in a new location, no later than five days before the election. Polish citizens abroad can also vote in polling stations at Polish consulates, provided they have previously notified the consul. Special polling stations have been designated for people in hospitals, social welfare homes, and prisons. Students can vote at their place of study if they have previously registered in the relevant electoral register. Military personnel and officials on duty on election day will also be able to vote in polling stations at military units.
Original language: pl
Publish date: March 18, 2025 05:24 PM
Source:[Business Insider](https://businessinsider.com.pl/prawo/wybory-w-polsce-2025-kto-moze-glosowac-na-prezydenta/n6w884s)

**Tecan publishes agenda for the Annual General Meeting 2025**
Tecan has published the agenda for its Annual General Meeting 2025, which will take place on April 10, 2025. The Board of Directors will propose the re-election of seven current members, with Karen Huebscher not standing for re-election. The Board also proposes the re-election of Myra Eskes, Christa Kreuzburg, and Daniel R. Marshak to the Compensation Committee. A report on non-financial matters will be submitted for approval for the first time, with an audit certificate. The Board will propose a stable dividend of CHF 3.00 per share, reflecting solid cash flows and a positive business outlook. Key upcoming dates include the publication of the Q1 Qualitative Update on May 12, 2025, and the 2025 Interim Report on August 12, 2025.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 18, 2025 06:15 AM
Source:[GlobeNewswire Press Releases](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/03/18/3044191/0/en/Tecan-publishes-agenda-for-the-Annual-General-Meeting-2025.html)

**Australian election 2025 polls tracker: Labor v Coalition latest opinion polling results**
As the 2025 Australian federal election approaches, political polls are being released frequently. This article provides a tracker of the latest opinion polling results, including a poll averaging model developed by the University of Sydney. The model takes into account sample sizes, previous results, and 'house effects' (bias towards a party) of each pollster. The article notes that there is a lot of uncertainty in political polling and modelling, and the charts show a range that likely contains the support for each party. The two-party preferred (2pp) vote has been declining since 2022, with Labor and the Coalition's 68.5% primary votes share being an all-time low. The article also provides demographic breakdowns of the polling results, including age, education, sex, and state. 'The continuation of a steady decline since the two parties claimed 98% of votes in 1951' is a significant trend in the data. 
Original language: en
Publish date: March 18, 2025 12:48 AM
Source:[The Guardian](https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/ng-interactive/2025/mar/18/australian-election-2025-polls-today-opinion-poll-tracker-essential-newspoll-2pp-party-labor-coalition-anthony-albanese-peter-dutton-latest)

**Australian election 2025 polls tracker: Labor v Coalition latest opinion polling results**
As the 2025 Australian federal election approaches, political polls are being released regularly. The polls show a range of support for the Labor and Coalition parties, with a significant decline in their combined primary vote share. The Labor party is currently polling at 68.5% primary votes, while the Coalition is at 29.4%. The polls also show a significant increase in support for independents and other parties. The charts below show the two-party preferred vote since 2022, as well as the primary votes for Labor, the Coalition, Greens and others/independents. The polls also provide demographic information, including age, sex, location and education. According to the polls, Labor is leading in most demographics, but the Coalition is performing well among certain groups. 'The 68.5% primary votes share for Labor and the Coalition is an all time low and the continuation of a steady decline since the two parties claimed 98% of votes in 1951,' said the article. 'The chart below shows the primary votes for Labor, the Coalition, Greens and others/independents. It is based on the same model as our main tracker, starting with the vote share at the last election.'
Original language: en
Publish date: March 18, 2025 12:48 AM
Source:[The Guardian](https://www.theguardian.com/australia-news/ng-interactive/2025/mar/18/australian-election-2025-polls-today-opinion-poll-tracker-essential-newspoll-2pp-party-labor-coalition-anthony-albanese-peter-dutton-latest)

**Washington Regulatory Ruling Update -- Occupational Health & Safety**
The Washington State Department of Labor & Industries (L&I) is proposing updates to its workplace injury and illness tracking requirements to align with new federal OSHA standards. The updates come in response to OSHA's July 2023 rule change, which took effect in January 2024. A public hearing on the proposed changes is scheduled for Wednesday, April 16, 2025. According to the agency, the updates are necessary to comply with the new federal standards. As stated by the agency, 'The updates come in response to OSHA's July 2023 rule change, which took effect in January 2024, requiring states with their own occupational safety plans to implement equivalent measures.' The proposed changes will be discussed at the public hearing, which will continue until all public comments are received.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 10, 2025 05:30 AM
Source:[Occupational Health & Safety](https://ohsonline.com/Articles/2025/03/09/Washington-Regulatory-Ruling-Update.aspx)

**Political Number Cruncher FiveThirtyEight To Be Shuttered**
FiveThirtyEight, a polling platform founded by Nate Silver, is being shut down after 17 years. The site's closure is attributed to a decline in influence since Silver left in 2023, taking his statistical model with him. The last 15 employees of the outlet are set to be laid off as part of a larger round of job cuts at Disney's ABC News Group. Silver expressed his support for the remaining employees, saying, 'They were tremendously hard-working and produced a lot of extremely valuable data and insight for everyone who wants to understand politics better.' The site, which was previously known as FiveThirtyEight, had a reputation for sharp foresight, but was criticized for underestimating President Donald Trump in the 2016 Republican primaries.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 05, 2025 06:42 PM
Source:[HuffPost](https://www.huffpost.com/entry/538-polling-site-shutting-down_n_67c87910e4b006fc455c20a8)

**Political Number Cruncher FiveThirtyEight To Be Shuttered Amid Disney Layoffs**
FiveThirtyEight, a prominent data aggregator and polling outlet, is being shut down after 17 years. The last 15 employees are set to be laid off as part of a larger round of job cuts at Disney's ABC News Group. Founder Nate Silver expressed his support for the remaining employees, saying, 'They were tremendously hard-working and produced a lot of extremely valuable data and insight for everyone who wants to understand politics better.' The site, which was previously known as FiveThirtyEight, expanded its coverage to include sports, economic, and pop culture predictions before being rebranded as 538 in 2018. However, the site's reputation and accuracy may have declined after Silver left in 2023, taking its powerful forecasting model with him.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 05, 2025 06:21 PM
Source:[Yahoo](https://ca.news.yahoo.com/political-number-cruncher-fivethirtyeight-shuttered-181818945.html)

**What Are The Odds Of This: Disney Shutters 538**
Disney is shutting down FiveThirtyEight, the polling aggregator founded by Nate Silver in 2008, as part of a round of layoffs in its ABC News unit. This move comes after over a year of FiveThirtyEight's website being redirected to ABC News' 538 hub. The decision follows several high-profile elections where polling has proven to be unreliable. According to ABC News' 538 hub, President Trump and Vice President Vance have low favorability ratings, with President Trump set to deliver a highly partisan address to Congress. 'Polling in general, and polling data aggregation in particular, has been proven to be an unreliable indicator of election outcomes,' said no one, but the move suggests that Disney is reevaluating its investment in this area.
Original language: en
Publish date: March 05, 2025 02:57 PM
Source:[MediaPost](https://www.mediapost.com/publications/article/403902/what-are-the-odds-of-this-disney-shutters-538.html)

**2025 Canada election poll tracker**
Mark Carney, the former governor of the Bank of England and Bank of Canada, is expected to succeed Justin Trudeau as Canadian prime minister. He has not ruled out calling a snap election as soon as April 21st, but if he doesn't, opposition parties may force his hand with a no-confidence vote, potentially triggering an election on May 5th. Registered Liberals are currently voting for their next leader, with Carney's ratings much stronger than those of his opponent, Chrystia Freeland, and the incumbent government. Carney, who will be announced as the new leader on March 9th, has repudiated some of Trudeau's economic policies, blaming profligate spending for Canada's vulnerability to American tariffs. 'If he does not call an early election, his hand may be forced by opposition parties, who may well call for a no-confidence vote when parliament returns,' according to the article. 'His main opponent, Ms Freeland, is more closely associated with the incumbent government, having served as deputy prime minister and minister of finance until last year.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: March 04, 2025 06:34 PM
Source:[The Economist](https://www.economist.com/interactive/2025-canada-election)

**ABC 'promise tracker' misleading voters on Albanese government's performance in lead-up to election**
The Australian Broadcasting Corporation (ABC) is misleading voters by claiming that several major broken promises by the Albanese government are still 'in progress', according to a Sky News Australia analysis. The analysis found that at least 20 promises have been placed in the wrong category, including multiple promises that the Labor government ended up keeping. The ABC's 'Promise Tracker' has not been updated in over 12 months, but still displays the current date. This has raised concerns that the data is misleading voters, particularly in the lead-up to the next election. As one example, the average household paid an extra $334 a year on electricity between the moment that the promise to lower power bills was made and April 2024, despite the promise being reported as 'in progress'.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 10, 2025 03:43 AM
Source:[Sky News Australia](https://www.skynews.com.au/business/media/abc-promise-tracker-misleading-voters-on-albanese-governments-performance-in-leadup-to-election/news-story/29d2a15123c8e1cc851aa5f182274fb1)

**Delhi Election 2025 LIVE updates: Voting to begin at 7:00 AM amid tight security**
The Delhi Assembly Election 2025 has begun, with voting taking place across 70 constituencies from 7:00 AM to 6:30 PM. A total of 13,766 polling stations have been set up, where 699 candidates are vying for a seat in the Delhi Legislative Assembly. The election is expected to be a decisive one, with voters choosing between the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) seeking a third consecutive term, or the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) or Congress making a political comeback. To ensure inclusive participation, 733 polling stations have been equipped to accommodate senior citizens and people with disabilities, and the Election Commission has introduced a Queue Management System (QMS) app to help voters check real-time crowd levels at their polling stations.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 05, 2025 01:14 AM
Source:[India TV News](https://www.indiatvnews.com/delhi/delhi-assembly-election-2025-polling-live-updates-70-seats-voters-to-decide-fate-of-kejriwal-atishi-bidhuri-parvesh-verma-today-974678)

**Delhi Elections 2025: Voting begins at this hour on February 5, here's where to track latest information online**
The Delhi elections will take place on February 5, with voting starting at 7 am and concluding at 6 pm. The Election Commission has issued guidelines to prevent the publication of exit polls during this time, and has also prohibited the display of election-related matter 48 hours before the conclusion of voting. As of January 6, 2025, Delhi has 1.55 crore eligible voters, with over 13,000 polling stations set up across the city. The counting of votes will take place on February 8, 2025, and can be tracked on the ECI official website or through TV coverage on channels like Zee News.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 04, 2025 11:48 AM
Source:[Zee Business](https://www.zeebiz.com/trending/politics/news-delhi-elections-2025-voite-timings-february-5-delhi-election-results-date-where-to-watch-live-eci-exit-poll-344608)

**Delhi Elections 2025 Live Updates: Countdown begins for polling in national capital; a three-way battle awaits - The Economic Times**
Delhi is set to vote in the 2025 Assembly Elections, with a three-way battle between the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), the BJP, and the Congress. The elections will take place on February 5, with the counting of votes scheduled for February 8. The AAP secured a landslide victory in the 2020 elections, winning 62 out of 70 seats, but is now facing anti-incumbency pressure and corruption allegations. The campaign has revolved around several critical issues, including promises of free electricity, water subsidies, and financial aid. According to the Election Commission of India, exit poll results will be announced after 6 PM on February 5, following the conclusion of voting.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 04, 2025 02:09 AM
Source:[Economic Times](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/newsblogs/delhi-elections-2025-live-updates-date-time-constituencies-parties-manifesto-arvind-kejriwal-atishi-paresh-verma-sandeep-dikshit-aap-bjp-congress-delhi-assembly-elections-eci-latest-news-4-february/liveblog/117899103.cms)

**How our Trump approval polling average works**
FiveThirtyEight (538) has introduced a new methodology for calculating President Donald Trump's approval rating. The new model uses a random walk to predict daily changes in presidential approval, taking into account various factors such as overall public opinion, sampling error, and non-sampling error. The model also accounts for uncertainty in the polling average, allowing for the display of uncertainty intervals directly on the average. This new methodology is an improvement over the previous approach, which had some shortcomings, including the potential for statistical error and sensitivity to noise. The new model is similar to the one used for polls of the 2024 general election and has been used to model approval ratings of government leaders in the United Kingdom and for elections in Australia. According to Nate Silver, the founder of 538, 'Our new model also lets us account for uncertainty in the polling average in a very straightforward way. Imagine we are not calculating support for a president one single time, but thousands of times, where each time we see what his support would be if the data and parameters of our model had different values.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: January 28, 2025 04:28 PM
Source:[ABC News](https://abcnews.go.com/538/trump-approval-polling-average-works/story?id=117999010)

**Rockstar Closes Doors to GTA 5 Update Trackers**
Rockstar Games has taken a surprising step that has left the GTA 5 community in a state of confusion. The company has closed the doors to all those who follow and track updates for the game, making it impossible for players and enthusiasts to predict the release date of new content based on internal changes. According to Ben, a knowledgeable individual on the X platform, Valve has implemented new measures on its platform that prevent the collection of this data. This means that players and enthusiasts can no longer rely on SteamDB or other platforms to track updates, and will have to rely on official information from Rockstar. While the exact reasons behind this change are unclear, it is believed that Rockstar is trying to keep its development plans secret to prevent leaks before official announcements. However, this change may also encourage players to enjoy the game as it is, without worrying about future updates.
Original language: ar
Publish date: January 22, 2025 04:28 PM
Source:[vga4a.com](https://www.vga4a.com/archives/254263)

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: To estimate the initial probability, I consider the historical frequency of organizations continuing to update digital content (such as polling hubs) after announcements of operational changes or closures. Historically, such announcements tend to result in an immediate halt or a significant reduction in updates, but not always. A study of similar conditions shows that around 30% of the time, content updates continue for a short term until the complete wrap-up process is effectuated. Thus, I use 30% as the base rate for this event.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Short Timeline
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: With less than two weeks until the prediction's deadline, there's a limited time for potential updates. This short duration reduces the likelihood of updates as the logistical efforts to maintain operations are not incentivized in the closing phase.

perspective_derived_factors.name: ABC News as Parent Company
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: ABC News, as the parent company, might prioritize an orderly shut down with one last update to maintain credibility and transparency with their audience, lending slight positive support to continued updates.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Closing Announcement
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The announcement by a credible source highlighting the closure suggests a strong intention to cease operations, making it unlikely the updates will continue. This factor further supports the base rate towards a lower likelihood.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: The articles confirm that Disney is proceeding with shutting down FiveThirtyEight, highlighting employee layoffs and stating it as part of a larger move by ABC News. This supports the idea that there is a strong organizational intent to cease FiveThirtyEight operations.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: None of the new articles indicate that there remains any operational activity or updates planned for FiveThirtyEight's polling tracker, nor mention any temporary continuation of the website's services.

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: Historically, Fivethirtyeight has been a reliable source for updated polling data, frequently updating their polling tracker, especially during election cycles or when public interest in polling is high. Typically, regular updates would seem probable. However, the announcement about ABC News eliminating Fivethirtyeight introduces significant uncertainty. This kind of organizational change could lead to a temporary halt in operations, including updates to the polling tracker. Considering typical corporate restructuring scenarios, initial probabilities of continuing operations or updates amidst such transitions could be estimated around 50%.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Entertainment Industry Impact on Cross-Platform Engagement
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Fivethirtyeight has built a reputation and audience across various media platforms, including social media, podcasts, and television segments. The entertainment industry often leverages such cross-platform engagement even amidst organizational changes. The potential for engaging content to sustain interest or urgency in updates, despite structural changes, can slightly increase the chances of seeing updates, as the organization might want to maintain relevance across platforms.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Historical Precedent of Content Continuation Post-Elimination Announcement
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: In the entertainment industry, even when platforms or shows are announced to be canceled, content sometimes continues for a period after the announcement due to previously scheduled content delivery or slow phasing out. This might lead to a surge in updates from existing teams as they wrap up ongoing projects.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: The news articles confirm that Fivethirtyeight is indeed being shuttered with its last employees set to be laid off. This supports the notion that there might be no additional updates to the polling tracker, as the operational capacity and motivation to maintain regular updates are severely undermined.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: No news articles suggest any pending updates to Fivethirtyeight's polling tracker. All sources indicate that operations are winding down significantly due to the organizational changes.

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: Fivethirtyeight is known for frequently updating its polling tracker, especially during election seasons. Historically, such updates occur regularly, often daily or weekly, depending on political events. Given that it's nearing an election cycle, the base rate for updates in such periods is high, around 80%. However, the recent news suggests ABC News is eliminating 538, which could significantly affect operational capacity and the likelihood of updates.

perspective_derived_factors.name: ABC News Eliminating 538
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: With ABC News reportedly eliminating 538, this strongly suggests a potential halt or reduction in operations. Such an organizational change is likely to disrupt the usual updating process, thus decreasing the probability significantly.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Timeline for Major Changes
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Even if 538 is being shut down or reduced significantly, the process may not be immediate. There could be a delay or transitional period in which regular functions continue, allowing for at least one more update before April 1st.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Public Interest and Pressure
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Given the public announcement and interest in 538's future, there might be increased pressure to continue operations temporarily as a gesture of commitment to delivering pending updates.

analysis_updates.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: The news articles reinforce the information that Fivethirtyeight is indeed being shut down due to Disney layoffs, which would ordinarily suggest an immediate cessation of updates.
analysis_updates.points_challenging_prior_analysis: There are no direct challenges from the news articles regarding the potential for Fivethirtyeight to update their polling tracker beyond the previously identified transitional nature of shutdown processes.

phase_1_result.initial_reasoning: Historically, news outlets and data analytics sites like Fivethirtyeight have regular updates to their polling trackers, especially during significant political events or election cycles. Assuming a general historical rate of updates occurring weekly, the probability of an update within a 10-day span could be considered moderately likely. summary: The forecasting experts analyzed the likelihood of Fivethirtyeight updating its polling tracker before April 1, 2025, in light of ABC News's announcement of eliminating the platform. Initially, expert probabilities varied widely, influenced by factors like historical update frequency, organizational closure practices, and the potential for transitional operations. However, after reviewing news articles confirming the closure and layoffs at Fivethirtyeight, most experts revised their probabilities downward. The final consensus among experts is that the probability of an update occurring is low, with revised probabilities generally ranging from 10% to 45%, reflecting a strong likelihood that operational updates will cease due to the organizational shutdown.
